boardgame.name: Yspahan
boardgame.description: 1598. Yspahan the fair becomes the capital of the Persian empire. Thus, being placed at the center of the world, the city enjoys a period of cultural and economic blossoming. The cities and villages of the region intend to take advantage of this expansion. Caravans loaded with goods and jewels set out for the desert, bearing the promises of a radiant future...._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The players embody merchants trading with Yspahan. Meaning to take advantage of the coming of the Shah_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s supervisor, they score points by placing their merchandise in the right shops, by sending them to the caravan, and by constructing buildings._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In Yspahan, players draft their action for the turn in order, but a roll of the dice determines which actions are available and how powerful they will be. You can earn points in the short-term by claiming shops in the city or by sending your traders to the caravan. You can also improve your infrastructure by constructing buildings that improve your actions or picking up action cards that give you extra options. Every 7 turns (each _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;week_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;), points are scored in the city and caravan, and after 3 weeks, the wise traders will see who among them has profited the most..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: The game is new and still in shrink shipping to France : 7 Euros Shipping to Europa : 9 euros Shipping to rest of the world : 13 euros

never used +++++ german version, but the game components are completely language independent anyway and you can download english or french rules translations from ystari´s +++++ will be shipped insured ++++++++++ international payment : paypal OR direct bank to bank transfer (wich is cost-free inside european union by the way) OR cash (in a registered letter, exchanged into euros already) +++++ payment for germany : paypal OR personal pick up in berlin OR direct bank to bank transfer +++++ for all : no checks ! ++++++++++ international buyers beware : though german postal is relatively fast, they sadly aren´t cheap. it costs bewteen 19 - 37 euros for parcels up to a weight of 5 kg (= about 4 big boxed boardgames). price depends on where the package has to be shipped, so please ask for prices, before you hit the buy button ! +++++ insured shipment inside germany costs 8 euros

QWG Master Print Series -- Yspahan Language: Dutch 2 to 4 players 8 year and older Duration: 45 to 60 min New -- mint condition -- unopened -- still in shrink wrap. Weight: 0,820 kg Theme: #2 in the Master Print series. 1598. Yspahan the fair becomes the capital of the Persian Empire. Thus, being placed at the centre of the world, the city enjoys a period of cultural and economic blossoming. The cities and villages of the region intend to take advantage of this expansion. Caravans loaded with goods and jewels set out for the desert, bearing the promises of a radiant future. The players embody merchants trading with Yspahan. Meaning to take advantage of the coming of the Shah’s Supervisor, they score points by placing their goods in the right shops, by sending them to the Caravan, and by constructing buildings. At the end of the game, the player with the highest score is the winner. See Details (more info) or below for complete selling, payment and shipping conditions.

Rio Grande Games (RIO306) 1598, Yspahan the fair becomes the capital of the Persian empire. Thus, being placed at the center of the world, the city enjoys a period of cultural and economic blossoming. The cities and villages of the region intend to take advantage of this expansion. Caravans loaded with goods and jewels set out for the desert, bearing the promises of a radiant future. The players embody merchants trading with Yspahan. Meaning to take advantage of the coming of the Shah_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Supervisor, they score points by placing their goods in the right shops, by sending them to the Caravan, and by constructing buildings. At the end of the game, the player with the highest score is the winner.
